t: Zephaniah 1
The*p word of the Lord*s that came to Zephaniah son of Cushi, son of Gedaliah, son of Amariah, son of Hezekiah, in the days of Josiah son of Amon, king of Judah.
The Great Day of the Lord
I*pn will completely sweep away everything from*ln the face of the earth— this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.

I*pn will sweep away people and animals; I*ln will sweep away the birds of the sky and*ln the fish of the sea, and*ln the ruins along with the wicked. I*ln will cut off mankind from*ln the face of the earth. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.

I*pn will stretch out my hand against Judah and*ln against all the residents of Jerusalem. I*ln will cut off every vestige of Baal from*ln this place, the*ln names of the pagan priests along*ln with the priests;
those*ln who bow in worship on the rooftops to*ln the stars in the sky; those*ln who bow and pledge loyalty to the Lord*s but*ln also pledge loyalty to Milcom;
and*ln those who turn back from following the Lord,*s who*ln do not seek the Lord*s or inquire of him.
Be*ln silent in the presence of the Lord God,*s for*ln the day of the Lord*s is near. Indeed,*ln the Lord*s has prepared a sacrifice; he*ln has consecrated his guests.
On*pn the day of the Lord’s*s sacrifice I*ln will punish the officials, the king’s sons, and*ln all who are dressed in foreign clothing.
On*ln that day I will punish all*ln who skip over the threshold, who*ln fill their master’s house with*ln violence and deceit.
On*pn that day — this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — there*pn will be an outcry from the Fish Gate, a*ln wailing from the Second District, and*ln a loud crashing from the hills.
Wail,*ln you residents of the Hollow, for*ln all the merchants will be silenced; all*ln those loaded with silver will be cut off.
And*pn at that time I will search Jerusalem with lamps and*ln punish those who settle down comfortably, who*ln say to themselves: The*ln Lord*s will do nothing - good or bad.
Their*ln wealth will become plunder and*ln their houses a ruin. They*ln will build houses but never live in them, plant*ln vineyards but never drink their wine.
The*pn great day of the Lord*s is near, near*ln and rapidly approaching. Listen,*ln the day of the Lord—*s then*ln the warrior’s cry is bitter.
That*ln day is a day of wrath, a*ln day of trouble and distress, a*ln day of destruction and desolation, a*ln day of darkness and gloom, a*ln day of clouds and total darkness,
a*ln day of ram’s horn and battle cry against*ln the fortified cities, and*ln against the high corner towers.
I*ln will bring distress on mankind, and*ln they will walk like the blind because*ln they have sinned against the Lord.*s Their*ln blood will be poured out like dust and*ln their flesh like dung.

Their*ln silver and their gold will*ln be unable to rescue them on*ln the day of the Lord’s*s wrath. The*ln whole earth will be consumed by*ln the fire of his jealousy, for*ln he will make a complete, yes,*ln a horrifying end of*ln all the inhabitants of the earth.
Zephaniah 2
A Call to Repentance
Gather*pn yourselves together; gather*ln together, undesirable nation,
before*ln the decree takes effect and*ln the day passes like chaff, before*ln the burning of the Lord’s*s anger overtakes you, before*ln the day of the Lord’s*s anger overtakes you.
Seek*ln the Lord,*s all you humble of the earth, who*ln carry out what he commands. Seek*ln righteousness, seek humility; perhaps*ln you will be concealed on*ln the day of the Lord’s*s anger.
Judgment against the Nations
For*pn Gaza will be abandoned, and*ln Ashkelon will become a ruin. Ashdod*ln will be driven out at noon, and*ln Ekron will be uprooted.
Woe,*ln inhabitants of the seacoast, nation*ln of the Cherethites! The*ln word of the Lord*s is against you, Canaan,*ln land of the Philistines: I*ln will destroy you until there is no one left.
The*ln seacoast will become pasturelands with*ln caves for shepherds and pens for sheep.

The*ln coastland will belong to*ln the remnant of the house of Judah; they*ln will find pasture there. They*ln will lie down in the evening among*ln the houses of Ashkelon, for*ln the Lord*s their God will return to them and*ln restore their fortunes.
I*pn have heard the taunting of Moab and*ln the insults of the Ammonites, who*ln have taunted my people and*ln threatened their territory.

Therefore,*ln as I live — this*lg is the declaration of the Lord*s of Armies, the God of Israel — Moab*pn will be like Sodom and*ln the Ammonites like Gomorrah: a*ln place overgrown with weeds, a*ln salt pit, and a perpetual wasteland. The*ln remnant of my people will plunder them; the*ln remainder of my nation will dispossess them.
This*ln is what they get for their pride, because*ln they have taunted and acted arrogantly against*ln the people of the Lord*s of Armies.

The*ln Lord*s will be terrifying to them when*ln he starves all the gods of the earth. Then*ln all the distant coasts and islands of the nations will*ln bow in worship to him, each*ln in its own place.
You*pn Cushites will also be slain by my sword.
He*pn will also stretch out his hand against the north and*ln destroy Assyria; he*ln will make Nineveh a desolate ruin, dry*ln as the desert.

Herds*ln will lie down in the middle of it, every*ln kind of wild animal. Both*ln eagle owls and herons will*ln roost in the capitals of its pillars. Their*ln calls will sound from the window, but*ln devastation will be on the threshold, for*ln he will expose the cedar work.

This*ln is the jubilant city that*ln lives in security, that*ln says to herself: I*ln exist, and there is no one else. What*ln a desolation she has become, a*ln place for wild animals to lie down! Everyone*ln who passes by her scoffs*ln and shakes his fist.
Zephaniah 3
Woe to Oppressive Jerusalem
Woe*pn to the city that is rebellious and defiled, the*ln oppressive city!
She*ln has not obeyed; she*ln has not accepted discipline. She*ln has not trusted in the Lord;*s she*ln has not drawn near to her God.
The*ln princes within her are roaring lions; her*ln judges are wolves of the night, which*ln leave nothing for the morning.
Her*ln prophets are reckless— treacherous*ln men. Her*ln priests profane the sanctuary; they*ln do violence to instruction.
The*ln righteous Lord*s is in her; he*ln does no wrong. He*ln applies his justice morning by morning; he*ln does not fail at dawn, yet*ln the one who does wrong knows no shame.

I*pn have cut off nations; their*ln corner towers are destroyed. I*ln have laid waste their streets, with*ln no one to pass through. Their*ln cities lie devastated, without*ln a person, without an inhabitant.

I*ln said: You will certainly fear me and*ln accept correction. Then*ln her dwelling place would*ln not be cut off based*ln on all that I had allocated to her. However,*ln they became more corrupt in*ln all their actions.

Therefore,*ln wait for me— this*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration — until*pn the day I rise up for plunder. For*ln my decision is to gather nations, to*ln assemble kingdoms, in*ln order to pour out my indignation on them, all*ln my burning anger; for*ln the whole earth will be consumed by*ln the fire of my jealousy.
Final Restoration Promised
For*pn I will then restore pure*ln speech to the peoples so*ln that all of them may call on*ln the name of the Lord*s and*ln serve him with a single purpose.
From*ln beyond the rivers of Cush my*ln supplicants, my dispersed people, will*ln bring an offering to me.

On*ln that day you will not be put to shame because*ln of everything you have done in*ln rebelling against me. For*ln then I will remove from*ln among you your jubilant, arrogant people, and*ln you will never again be haughty on*ln my holy mountain.
I*ln will leave a*ln meek and humble people among you, and*ln they will take refuge in the name of the Lord.*s
The*ln remnant of Israel will no longer do*ln wrong or tell lies; a*ln deceitful tongue will not be found in*ln their mouths. They*ln will pasture and lie down, with*ln nothing to make them afraid.
Sing*pn for joy, Daughter Zion; shout*ln loudly, Israel! Be*ln glad and celebrate with all your heart, Daughter*ln Jerusalem!
The*ln Lord*s has removed your punishment; he*ln has turned back your enemy. The*ln King of Israel, the Lord,*s is among you; you*ln need no longer fear harm.
On*ln that day it will be said to Jerusalem: “Do*ln not fear; Zion,*ln do not let your hands grow weak.
The*ln Lord*s your God is among you, a*ln warrior who saves. He*ln will rejoice over you with gladness. He*ln will be quiet in his love. He*ln will delight in you with singing.”
I*pn will gather those who have been driven from*ln the appointed festivals; they*ln will be a tribute from you and*ln a reproach on her.

Yes,*ln at that time I*ln will deal with all who oppress you. I*ln will save the lame and gather the outcasts; I*ln will make those who were disgraced throughout*ln the earth receive*ln praise and fame.

At*ln that time I will bring you back, yes,*ln at the time I will gather you. I*ln will give you fame and praise among*ln all the peoples of the earth, when*ln I restore your fortunes before your eyes. The*ln Lord*s has spoken.
